attributes.action: Save our Beaufort Hill Community Miners Welfare Hall
attributes.additional_details: Beaufort Welfare Hall was built by the miners who had one penny deducted from their weekly salary & it officially opened in 1935.Since then, it has become a social and community hub,with groups of all ages – from toddlers to the elderly using the hall every day throughout the week.“We cover five wards in Blaenau Gwent & actually have people coming from Monmouthshire, like Abergavenny, Newport and Torfaen.“Our main concern is that a lot of the members we have have autism spectrum disorder. Please Save our Beaufort Hill Community Miners Welfare Hall.
